intro: Ruellia gloeocalyx, commonly known as the silverleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a silvery-white underside, giving it its common name. Its showy blue to violet flowers are arranged in spikes and bloom during the spring and summer months. Ruellia gloeocalyx is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and floral display.
